question: Which of the following is correct about the coefficient of limiting friction between any two surfaces in contact?
option1: it is equal to twice the tangent of angle of friction
option2: it is equal to twice the sine of angle of friction
option3: it is equal to the tangent of angle of friction
option4: it is equal to the sine of angle of friction
answer: it is equal to the tangent of angle of friction
explanation: The coefficient of limiting friction between any two surfaces in contact is equal to the tangent of angle of friction between them. u = tan Q where u = coefficient of limiting friction and Q = angle of friction
